hillbillies.model

Class Faction

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.Faction

  • public class Faction
extends java.lang.Object
    A class describing Factions that are active in the World, with a set of Units and a Scheduler.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kevin Algoet & Jeroen Depuydt 1ba Informatica
    Invariants:
  • Each Faction must have proper Units.
  • Each Faction must have a proper Scheduler.
  • Each Faction must have a proper World.
    • Note:
    Repository link: https://github.com/KivinA/ProjectOGP

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      Faction(World world)
      Initialize this new Faction with the given World.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Faction

        public Faction(World world)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
               java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Initialize this new Faction with the given World.
        Effects:
      • Set the World of this Faction to the given World.
      • Set the Scheduler of this Faction to the newly created Scheduler.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

    • Method Detail

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Terminate this Faction.
        Postcondition:
        The terminated state of this Faction is enabled.
        Effects:
      • Set the World of this Faction ineffective.
      • Terminate the Scheduler of this Faction.
      • Set the Scheduler of this Faction ineffective.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - There are still Units attached to this Faction.

      • isTerminated

        @Basic
 @Raw
public boolean isTerminated()
        Check whether this Faction is terminated or not.

      • getNbOfUnits

        @Basic
 @Raw
public int getNbOfUnits()
        Return the number of Units associated with this Faction.

      • hasAsUnit

        public boolean hasAsUnit(@Raw
                         Unit unit)
        Check whether this Faction has the given Unit as one of its Units.
        Parameters:
        unit - The Unit to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given Unit is registered as a Unit of this Faction.

      • canHaveAsUnit

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsUnit(Unit unit)
        Check whether this Faction can have the given Unit as one of its Units.
        Parameters:
        unit - The Unit to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given Unit is effective, if the number of Units isn't higher or equal to the maximum number of Units and if the given Unit is part of this Faction's World.

      • addUnit

        @Raw
public void addUnit(@Raw
                          Unit unit)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add a given Unit to this faction.
        Parameters:
        unit - The Unit to add.
        Postconditions:
      • The number of Units of this Faction is incremented by 1.
      • This Faction has the given unit as one of its units.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This Faction cannot have the given Unit as one of its Units.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • canRemoveAsUnit

        @Raw
public boolean canRemoveAsUnit(Unit unit)
        Check whether this Faction can remove the given Unit from its Units.
        Parameters:
        unit - The Unit to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given Unit is effective, if this Faction has the given Unit as one of its Units and if the given Unit doesn't reference any Faction.

      • removeUnit

        @Raw
public void removeUnit(@Raw
                             Unit unit)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Remove a given Unit from the list of Units of this Faction.
        Parameters:
        unit - The Unit to remove.
        Postconditions:
      • The number of Units of this Faction is decremented by 1.
      • This Faction no longer has the given Unit as one of its Units.
        • Effect:
        If the list of Units is empty after removing the given Unit, remove this Faction from the World.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This Faction cannot remove the given Unit from its Units.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • getAllUnits

        public java.util.Set<Unit> getAllUnits()
        Return a set containing all the Units of this Faction.
        Returns:
        The resulting set is effective.
        Returns:
        The number of elements in the resulting list is equal to the number of Units attached to this Faction.
        Returns:
        Each element of the resulting set equals a Unit that is attached to this Faction.

      • hasProperUnits

        public boolean hasProperUnits()
        Check whether this Faction has proper Units attached to it.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this Faction can have each Unit as one its Units and if each of these Units references this Faction as the Faction to which they are attached.

      • getWorld

        @Basic
 @Raw
public World getWorld()
        Return the World to which this Faction is attached.

      • canHaveAsWorld

        public boolean canHaveAsWorld(World world)
        Check whether this Faction can have the given World as its World.
        Parameters:
        world - The World to check.
        Returns:
        If this Faction is terminated, true if and only if the given World is ineffective. Otherwise, true if and only if the given World is effective and if the given World can have this Faction as one of its Factions.

      • setWorld

        @Raw
public void setWorld(World world)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Set the World of this Faction to the given World.
        Parameters:
        world - The new World for this Faction.
        Postcondition:
        The World of this Faction is equal to the given World.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This Faction cannot have the given World as its World.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This Faction already has an effective World.
        Note:
        A Faction can only have an effective World assigned just once.

      • hasProperWorld

        public boolean hasProperWorld()
        Check whether this Faction has a proper World attached to it.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this Faction can have the attached World as its World and if that World is ineffective or has this Faction as one of its Factions.

      • getScheduler

        @Basic
 @Raw
public Scheduler getScheduler()
        Return the Scheduler that is attached to this Faction.

      • canHaveAsScheduler

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsScheduler(Scheduler scheduler)
        Check whether this Faction can have the given Scheduler as its Scheduler.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - The Scheduler to check.
        Returns:
        If this Faction is terminated, true if and only if the given Scheduler is ineffective. Otherwise, true if and only if this Faction doesn't have a Scheduler, if the given Scheduler is effective and if the given Scheduler isn't terminated.

      • setScheduler

        @Raw
public void setScheduler(Scheduler scheduler)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                               java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Assign the given Scheduler to this Faction.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - The new Scheduler for this Faction.
        Postcondition:
        The Scheduler of this new Faction is equal to the given Scheduler.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This Faction cannot have the given Scheduler as its Scheduler.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This Faction already has an effective Scheduler.
        Note:
        A Faction can only have an effective Scheduler assigned just once.

      • hasProperScheduler

        public boolean hasProperScheduler()
        Check whether this Faction has a proper Scheduler attached to it.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this Faction can have the attached Scheduler as its Scheduler and if the attached Scheduler is either ineffective or if the Faction of this Scheduler is equal to this Faction.
